alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Gilmer; Murray; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:53AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gilmer, northeastern Murray, east central Whitfield and northwestern Fannin Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 253 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Conasauga to near Crandall to Dawnville, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Chatsworth, Eton, Crandall, Sumac, Jones Mill, Higdon, Gregory, Cohutta Wilderness, Epworth, Conasauga Lake, Tennga, Dawnville, Cisco, and Colwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.
